meanings.definition: The state or condition of being compelled or forced to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her compulsivities made her clean the house every day without fail.
meanings.sent2: His compulsivities to check the door lock multiple times before leaving were exhausting.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's compulsivities to organize her bookshelf by color amused her friends.
meanings.sent4: The compulsivities of the waves crashing against the shore were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The compulsivities of the clock ticking echoed through the empty room.

meanings.definition: The quality of being difficult to resist or control.
meanings.sent1: The compulsivities of his sweet tooth often led him to eat too much candy.
meanings.sent2: The compulsivities of procrastination can hinder productivity.
meanings.sent3: The compulsivities of the mischievous puppy to chew on shoes always caused chaos.
meanings.sent4: The compulsivities of the wind to sway the trees created a calming rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The compulsivities of laughter spreading through the room lifted everyone's spirits.
